summary.long: 2 Corinthians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text:
Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, and Timothy our brother,
To the church of God that is at Corinth, with all the saints who are in the whole of Achaia:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies and God of all comfort,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who comforts us in all our affliction, so that we may be able to comfort those who are in any affliction, with the comfort with which we ourselves are comforted by God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as we share abundantly in Christ's sufferings, so through Christ we share abundantly in comfort too.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we are afflicted, it is for your comfort and salvation; and if we are comforted, it is for your comfort, which you experience when you patiently endure the same sufferings that we suffer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our hope for you is unshaken, for we know that as you share in our sufferings, you will also share in our comfort.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we do not want you to be ignorant, brothers, of the affliction we experienced in Asia. For we were so utterly burdened beyond our strength that we despaired of life itself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, we felt that we had received the sentence of death. But that was to make us rely not on ourselves but on God who raises the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He delivered us from such a deadly peril, and he will deliver us. On him we have set our hope that he will deliver us again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You also must help us by prayer, so that many will give thanks on our behalf for the blessing granted us through the prayers of many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For our boast is this, the testimony of our conscience, that we behaved in the world with simplicity and godly sincerity, not by earthly wisdom but by the grace of God, and supremely so towards you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we are not writing to you anything other than what you read and acknowledge and I hope you will fully acknowledge—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as you did partially acknowledge us—that on the day of our Lord Jesus you will boast of us as we will boast of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because I was sure of this, I wanted to come to you first, so that you might have a second experience of grace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I wanted to visit you on my way to Macedonia, and to come back to you from Macedonia and have you send me on my way to Judea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Was I vacillating when I wanted to do this? Do I make my plans according to the flesh, ready to say “Yes, yes” and “No, no” at the same time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As surely as God is faithful, our word to you has not been Yes and No.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of God, Jesus Christ, whom we proclaimed among you, Silvanus and Timothy and I, was not Yes and No, but in him it is always Yes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all the promises of God find their Yes in him. That is why it is through him that we utter our Amen to God for his glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it is God who establishes us with you in Christ, and has anointed us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and who has also put his seal on us and given us his Spirit in our hearts as a guarantee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I call God to witness against me—it was to spare you that I refrained from coming again to Corinth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not that we lord it over your faith, but we work with you for your joy, for you stand firm in your faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I made up my mind not to make another painful visit to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if I cause you pain, who is there to make me glad but the one whom I have pained?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I wrote as I did, so that when I came I might not suffer pain from those who should have made me rejoice, for I felt sure of all of you, that my joy would be the joy of you all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I wrote to you out of much affliction and anguish of heart and with many tears, not to cause you pain but to let you know the abundant love that I have for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if anyone has caused pain, he has caused it not to me, but in some measure—not to put it too severely—to all of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For such a one, this punishment by the majority is enough,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so you should rather turn to forgive and comfort him, or he may be overwhelmed by excessive sorrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I beg you to reaffirm your love for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is why I wrote, that I might test you and know whether you are obedient in everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone whom you forgive, I also forgive. Indeed, what I have forgiven, if I have forgiven anything, has been for your sake in the presence of Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that we would not be outwitted by Satan; for we are not ignorant of his designs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I came to Troas to preach the gospel of Christ, even though a door was opened for me in the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: my spirit was not at rest because I did not find my brother Titus there. So I took leave of them and went on to Macedonia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But thanks be to God, who in Christ always leads us in triumphal procession, and through us spreads the fragrance of the knowledge of him everywhere.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we are the aroma of Christ to God among those who are being saved and among those who are perishing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to one a fragrance from death to death, to the other a fragrance from life to life. Who is sufficient for these things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we are not, like so many, peddlers of God's word, but as men of sincerity, as commissioned by God, in the sight of God we speak in Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are we beginning to commend ourselves again? Or do we need, as some do, letters of recommendation to you, or from you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You yourselves are our letter of recommendation, written on our hearts, to be known and read by all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you show that you are a letter from Christ delivered by us, written not with ink but with the Spirit of the living God, not on tablets of stone but on tablets of human hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Such is the confidence that we have through Christ towards God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not that we are sufficient in ourselves to claim anything as coming from us, but our sufficiency is from God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who has made us competent to be ministers of a new covenant, not of the letter but of the Spirit. For the letter kills, but the Spirit gives life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if the ministry of death, carved in letters on stone, came with such glory that the Israelites could not gaze at Moses' face because of its glory, which was being brought to an end,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: will not the ministry of the Spirit have even more glory?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if there was glory in the ministry of condemnation, the ministry of righteousness must far exceed it in glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, in this case, what once had glory has come to have no glory at all, because of the glory that surpasses it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if what was being brought to an end came with glory, much more will what is permanent have glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since we have such a hope, we are very bold,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not like Moses, who would put a veil over his face so that the Israelites might not gaze at the outcome of what was being brought to an end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But their minds were hardened. For to this day, when they read the old covenant, that same veil remains unlifted, because only through Christ is it taken away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, to this day whenever Moses is read a veil lies over their hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when one turns to the Lord, the veil is removed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord is the Spirit, and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is freedom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we all, with unveiled face, beholding the glory of the Lord, are being transformed into the same image from one degree of glory to another. For this comes from the Lord who is the Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, having this ministry by the mercy of God, we do not lose heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we have renounced disgraceful, underhanded ways. We refuse to practise cunning or to tamper with God's word, but by the open statement of the truth we would commend ourselves to everyone's conscience in the sight of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And even if our gospel is veiled, it is veiled only to those who are perishing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In their case the god of this world has blinded the minds of the unbelievers, to keep them from seeing the light of the gospel of the glory of Christ, who is the image of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what we proclaim is not ourselves, but Jesus Christ as Lord, with ourselves as your servants for Jesus' sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God, who said, “Let light shine out of darkness”, has shone in our hearts to give the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we have this treasure in jars of clay, to show that the surpassing power belongs to God and not to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are afflicted in every way, but not crushed; perplexed, but not driven to despair;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: persecuted, but not forsaken; struck down, but not destroyed;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: always carrying in the body the death of Jesus, so that the life of Jesus may also be manifested in our bodies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we who live are always being given over to death for Jesus' sake, so that the life of Jesus also may be manifested in our mortal flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So death is at work in us, but life in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since we have the same spirit of faith according to what has been written, “I believed, and so I spoke”, we also believe, and so we also speak,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: knowing that he who raised the Lord Jesus will raise us also with Jesus and bring us with you into his presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is all for your sake, so that as grace extends to more and more people it may increase thanksgiving, to the glory of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So we do not lose heart. Though our outer self is wasting away, our inner self is being renewed day by day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this light momentary affliction is preparing for us an eternal weight of glory beyond all comparison,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as we look not to the things that are seen but to the things that are unseen. For the things that are seen are transient, but the things that are unseen are eternal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we know that if the tent that is our earthly home is destroyed, we have a building from God, a house not made with hands, eternal in the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in this tent we groan, longing to put on our heavenly dwelling,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if indeed by putting it on we may not be found naked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For while we are still in this tent, we groan, being burdened—not that we would be unclothed, but that we would be further clothed, so that what is mortal may be swallowed up by life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who has prepared us for this very thing is God, who has given us the Spirit as a guarantee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So we are always of good courage. We know that while we are at home in the body we are away from the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for we walk by faith, not by sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, we are of good courage, and we would rather be away from the body and at home with the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So whether we are at home or away, we make it our aim to please him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we must all appear before the judgement seat of Christ, so that each one may receive what is due for what he has done in the body, whether good or evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, knowing the fear of the Lord, we persuade others. But what we are is known to God, and I hope it is known also to your conscience.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are not commending ourselves to you again but giving you cause to boast about us, so that you may be able to answer those who boast about outward appearance and not about what is in the heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if we are beside ourselves, it is for God; if we are in our right mind, it is for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the love of Christ controls us, because we have concluded this: that one has died for all, therefore all have died;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he died for all, that those who live might no longer live for themselves but for him who for their sake died and was raised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From now on, therefore, we regard no one according to the flesh. Even though we once regarded Christ according to the flesh, we regard him thus no longer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, he is a new creation. The old has passed away; behold, the new has come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All this is from God, who through Christ reconciled us to himself and gave us the ministry of reconciliation;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that is, in Christ God was reconciling the world to himself, not counting their trespasses against them, and entrusting to us the message of reconciliation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, we are ambassadors for Christ, God making his appeal through us. We implore you on behalf of Christ, be reconciled to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For our sake he made him to be sin who knew no sin, so that in him we might become the righteousness of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Working together with him, then, we appeal to you not to receive the grace of God in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he says,
“In a favourable time I listened to you,
    and in a day of salvation I have helped you.”
Behold, now is the favourable time; behold, now is the day of salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We put no obstacle in anyone's way, so that no fault may be found with our ministry,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but as servants of God we commend ourselves in every way: by great endurance, in afflictions, hardships, calamities,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: beatings, imprisonments, riots, labours, sleepless nights, hunger;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by purity, knowledge, patience, kindness, the Holy Spirit, genuine love;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by truthful speech, and the power of God; with the weapons of righteousness for the right hand and for the left;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: through honour and dishonour, through slander and praise. We are treated as impostors, and yet are true;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as unknown, and yet well known; as dying, and behold, we live; as punished, and yet not killed;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as sorrowful, yet always rejoicing; as poor, yet making many rich; as having nothing, yet possessing everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have spoken freely to you, Corinthians; our heart is wide open.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not restricted by us, but you are restricted in your own affections.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In return (I speak as to children) widen your hearts also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not be unequally yoked with unbelievers. For what partnership has righteousness with lawlessness? Or what fellowship has light with darkness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What accord has Christ with Belial? Or what portion does a believer share with an unbeliever?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What agreement has the temple of God with idols? For we are the temple of the living God; as God said,
“I will make my dwelling among them and walk among them,
    and I will be their God,
    and they shall be my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore go out from their midst,
    and be separate from them, says the Lord,
and touch no unclean thing;
    then I will welcome you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and I will be a father to you,
    and you shall be sons and daughters to me,
says the Lord Almighty.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since we have these promises, beloved, let us cleanse ourselves from every defilement of body and spirit, bringing holiness to completion in the fear of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make room in your hearts for us. We have wronged no one, we have corrupted no one, we have taken advantage of no one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not say this to condemn you, for I said before that you are in our hearts, to die together and to live together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am acting with great boldness towards you; I have great pride in you; I am filled with comfort. In all our affliction, I am overflowing with joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For even when we came into Macedonia, our bodies had no rest, but we were afflicted at every turn—fighting without and fear within.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God, who comforts the downcast, comforted us by the coming of Titus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and not only by his coming but also by the comfort with which he was comforted by you, as he told us of your longing, your mourning, your zeal for me, so that I rejoiced still more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For even if I made you grieve with my letter, I do not regret it—though I did regret it, for I see that that letter grieved you, though only for a while.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As it is, I rejoice, not because you were grieved, but because you were grieved into repenting. For you felt a godly grief, so that you suffered no loss through us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For godly grief produces a repentance that leads to salvation without regret, whereas worldly grief produces death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For see what earnestness this godly grief has produced in you, but also what eagerness to clear yourselves, what indignation, what fear, what longing, what zeal, what punishment! At every point you have proved yourselves innocent in the matter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So although I wrote to you, it was not for the sake of the one who did the wrong, nor for the sake of the one who suffered the wrong, but in order that your earnestness for us might be revealed to you in the sight of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore we are comforted.
And besides our own comfort, we rejoiced still more at the joy of Titus, because his spirit has been refreshed by you all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whatever boasts I made to him about you, I was not put to shame. But just as everything we said to you was true, so also our boasting before Titus has proved true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his affection for you is even greater, as he remembers the obedience of you all, how you received him with fear and trembling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I rejoice, because I have perfect confidence in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We want you to know, brothers, about the grace of God that has been given among the churches of Macedonia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for in a severe test of affliction, their abundance of joy and their extreme poverty have overflowed in a wealth of generosity on their part.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they gave according to their means, as I can testify, and beyond their means, of their own accord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: begging us earnestly for the favour of taking part in the relief of the saints—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and this, not as we expected, but they gave themselves first to the Lord and then by the will of God to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Accordingly, we urged Titus that as he had started, so he should complete among you this act of grace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as you excel in everything—in faith, in speech, in knowledge, in all earnestness, and in our love for you—see that you excel in this act of grace also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say this not as a command, but to prove by the earnestness of others that your love also is genuine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that though he was rich, yet for your sake he became poor, so that you by his poverty might become rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in this matter I give my judgement: this benefits you, who a year ago started not only to do this work but also to desire to do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now finish doing it as well, so that your readiness in desiring it may be matched by your completing it out of what you have.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if the readiness is there, it is acceptable according to what a person has, not according to what he does not have.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I do not mean that others should be eased and you burdened, but that as a matter of fairness
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: your abundance at the present time should supply their need, so that their abundance may supply your need, that there may be fairness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As it is written, “Whoever gathered much had nothing left over, and whoever gathered little had no lack.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But thanks be to God, who put into the heart of Titus the same earnest care I have for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he not only accepted our appeal, but being himself very earnest he is going to you of his own accord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With him we are sending the brother who is famous among all the churches for his preaching of the gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And not only that, but he has been appointed by the churches to travel with us as we carry out this act of grace that is being ministered by us, for the glory of the Lord himself and to show our good will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We take this course so that no one should blame us about this generous gift that is being administered by us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for we aim at what is honourable not only in the Lord's sight but also in the sight of man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with them we are sending our brother whom we have often tested and found earnest in many matters, but who is now more earnest than ever because of his great confidence in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for Titus, he is my partner and fellow worker for your benefit. And as for our brothers, they are messengers of the churches, the glory of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So give proof before the churches of your love and of our boasting about you to these men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it is superfluous for me to write to you about the ministry for the saints,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I know your readiness, of which I boast about you to the people of Macedonia, saying that Achaia has been ready since last year. And your zeal has stirred up most of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I am sending the brothers so that our boasting about you may not prove empty in this matter, so that you may be ready, as I said you would be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Otherwise, if some Macedonians come with me and find that you are not ready, we would be humiliated—to say nothing of you—for being so confident.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I thought it necessary to urge the brothers to go on ahead to you and arrange in advance for the gift you have promised, so that it may be ready as a willing gift, not as an exaction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The point is this: whoever sows sparingly will also reap sparingly, and whoever sows bountifully will also reap bountifully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each one must give as he has decided in his heart, not reluctantly or under compulsion, for God loves a cheerful giver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God is able to make all grace abound to you, so that having all sufficiency in all things at all times, you may abound in every good work.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: He who supplies seed to the sower and bread for food will supply and multiply your seed for sowing and increase the harvest of your righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be enriched in every way to be generous in every way, which through us will produce thanksgiving to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the ministry of this service is not only supplying the needs of the saints but is also overflowing in many thanksgivings to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By their approval of this service, they will glorify God because of your submission flowing from your confession of the gospel of Christ, and the generosity of your contribution for them and for all others,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while they long for you and pray for you, because of the surpassing grace of God upon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thanks be to God for his inexpressible gift!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, Paul, myself entreat you, by the meekness and gentleness of Christ—I who am humble when face to face with you, but bold towards you when I am away!—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I beg of you that when I am present I may not have to show boldness with such confidence as I count on showing against some who suspect us of walking according to the flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For though we walk in the flesh, we are not waging war according to the flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the weapons of our warfare are not of the flesh but have divine power to destroy strongholds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We destroy arguments and every lofty opinion raised against the knowledge of God, and take every thought captive to obey Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: being ready to punish every disobedience, when your obedience is complete.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look at what is before your eyes. If anyone is confident that he is Christ's, let him remind himself that just as he is Christ's, so also are we.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For even if I boast a little too much of our authority, which the Lord gave for building you up and not for destroying you, I will not be ashamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not want to appear to be frightening you with my letters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they say, “His letters are weighty and strong, but his bodily presence is weak, and his speech of no account.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let such a person understand that what we say by letter when absent, we do when present.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not that we dare to classify or compare ourselves with some of those who are commending themselves. But when they measure themselves by one another and compare themselves with one another, they are without understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we will not boast beyond limits, but will boast only with regard to the area of influence God assigned to us, to reach even to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we are not overextending ourselves, as though we did not reach you. For we were the first to come all the way to you with the gospel of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We do not boast beyond limit in the labours of others. But our hope is that as your faith increases, our area of influence among you may be greatly enlarged,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that we may preach the gospel in lands beyond you, without boasting of work already done in another's area of influence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let the one who boasts, boast in the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is not the one who commends himself who is approved, but the one whom the Lord commends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I wish you would bear with me in a little foolishness. Do bear with me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I feel a divine jealousy for you, since I betrothed you to one husband, to present you as a pure virgin to Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I am afraid that as the serpent deceived Eve by his cunning, your thoughts will be led astray from a sincere and pure devotion to Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if someone comes and proclaims another Jesus than the one we proclaimed, or if you receive a different spirit from the one you received, or if you accept a different gospel from the one you accepted, you put up with it readily enough.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, I consider that I am not in the least inferior to these super-apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even if I am unskilled in speaking, I am not so in knowledge; indeed, in every way we have made this plain to you in all things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or did I commit a sin in humbling myself so that you might be exalted, because I preached God's gospel to you free of charge?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I robbed other churches by accepting support from them in order to serve you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when I was with you and was in need, I did not burden anyone, for the brothers who came from Macedonia supplied my need. So I refrained and will refrain from burdening you in any way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the truth of Christ is in me, this boasting of mine will not be silenced in the regions of Achaia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And why? Because I do not love you? God knows I do!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And what I do I will continue to do, in order to undermine the claim of those who would like to claim that in their boasted mission they work on the same terms as we do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For such men are false apostles, deceitful workmen, disguising themselves as apostles of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And no wonder, for even Satan disguises himself as an angel of light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it is no surprise if his servants, also, disguise themselves as servants of righteousness. Their end will correspond to their deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I repeat, let no one think me foolish. But even if you do, accept me as a fool, so that I too may boast a little.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What I am saying with this boastful confidence, I say not with the Lord's authority but as a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since many boast according to the flesh, I too will boast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you gladly bear with fools, being wise yourselves!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you bear it if someone makes slaves of you, or devours you, or takes advantage of you, or puts on airs, or strikes you in the face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To my shame, I must say, we were too weak for that!
But whatever anyone else dares to boast of—I am speaking as a fool—I also dare to boast of that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are they Hebrews? So am I. Are they Israelites? So am I. Are they offspring of Abraham? So am I.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are they servants of Christ? I am a better one—I am talking like a madman—with far greater labours, far more imprisonments, with countless beatings, and often near death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Five times I received at the hands of the Jews the forty lashes less one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three times I was beaten with rods. Once I was stoned. Three times I was shipwrecked; for a night and a day I was adrift at sea;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: on frequent journeys, in danger from rivers, danger from robbers, danger from my own people, danger from Gentiles, danger in the city, danger in the wilderness, danger at sea, danger from false brothers;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in toil and hardship, through many a sleepless night, in hunger and thirst, often without food, in cold and exposure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And, apart from other things, there is the daily pressure on me of my anxiety for all the churches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who is weak, and I am not weak? Who is made to fall, and I am not indignant?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I must boast, I will boast of the things that show my weakness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The God and Father of the Lord Jesus, he who is blessed for ever, knows that I am not lying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At Damascus, the governor under King Aretas was guarding the city of Damascus in order to seize me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I was let down in a basket through a window in the wall and escaped his hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I must go on boasting. Though there is nothing to be gained by it, I will go on to visions and revelations of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know a man in Christ who fourteen years ago was caught up to the third heaven—whether in the body or out of the body I do not know, God knows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I know that this man was caught up into paradise—whether in the body or out of the body I do not know, God knows—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he heard things that cannot be told, which man may not utter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On behalf of this man I will boast, but on my own behalf I will not boast, except of my weaknesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though if I should wish to boast, I would not be a fool, for I would be speaking the truth. But I refrain from it, so that no one may think more of me than he sees in me or hears from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So to keep me from becoming conceited because of the surpassing greatness of the revelations, a thorn was given me in the flesh, a messenger of Satan to harass me, to keep me from becoming conceited.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three times I pleaded with the Lord about this, that it should leave me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to me, “My grace is sufficient for you, for my power is made perfect in weakness.” Therefore I will boast all the more gladly of my weaknesses, so that the power of Christ may rest upon me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the sake of Christ, then, I am content with weaknesses, insults, hardships, persecutions, and calamities. For when I am weak, then I am strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have been a fool! You forced me to it, for I ought to have been commended by you. For I was not at all inferior to these super-apostles, even though I am nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The signs of a true apostle were performed among you with utmost patience, with signs and wonders and mighty works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in what were you less favoured than the rest of the churches, except that I myself did not burden you? Forgive me this wrong!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Here for the third time I am ready to come to you. And I will not be a burden, for I seek not what is yours but you. For children are not bound to save up for their parents, but parents for their children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will most gladly spend and be spent for your souls. If I love you more, am I to be loved less?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But granting that I myself did not burden you, I was crafty, you say, and got the better of you by deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did I take advantage of you through any of those whom I sent to you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I urged Titus to go, and sent the brother with him. Did Titus take advantage of you? Did we not act in the same spirit? Did we not take the same steps?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have you been thinking all along that we have been defending ourselves to you? It is in the sight of God that we have been speaking in Christ, and all for your upbuilding, beloved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I fear that perhaps when I come I may find you not as I wish, and that you may find me not as you wish—that perhaps there may be quarrelling, jealousy, anger, hostility, slander, gossip, conceit, and disorder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I fear that when I come again my God may humble me before you, and I may have to mourn over many of those who sinned earlier and have not repented of the impurity, sexual immorality, and sensuality that they have practised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the third time I am coming to you. Every charge must be established by the evidence of two or three witnesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I warned those who sinned before and all the others, and I warn them now while absent, as I did when present on my second visit, that if I come again I will not spare them—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since you seek proof that Christ is speaking in me. He is not weak in dealing with you, but is powerful among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he was crucified in weakness, but lives by the power of God. For we also are weak in him, but in dealing with you we will live with him by the power of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Examine yourselves, to see whether you are in the faith. Test yourselves. Or do you not realize this about yourselves, that Jesus Christ is in you?—unless indeed you fail to meet the test!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I hope you will find out that we have not failed the test.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we pray to God that you may not do wrong—not that we may appear to have met the test, but that you may do what is right, though we may seem to have failed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we cannot do anything against the truth, but only for the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we are glad when we are weak and you are strong. Your restoration is what we pray for.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason I write these things while I am away from you, that when I come I may not have to be severe in my use of the authority that the Lord has given me for building up and not for tearing down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally, brothers, rejoice. Aim for restoration, comfort one another, agree with one another, live in peace; and the God of love and peace will be with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Greet one another with a holy kiss.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the saints greet you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ and the love of God and the fellowship of the Holy Spirit be with you all.
verses.speaker: Narrator
